plan: First, I will try bidding close to my value for both A and B to observe competitors' typical bids. Then, I will go with a more aggressive strategy, bidding high on AB if my value is significantly higher than sum of A and B (around 1.5x). Additionally, I may bid low on single goods when my value for them is low, to gather data on average winning bids. Furthermore, if I notice specific bidding patterns from Betty or Charles, I will leverage that information in my future bids.

I plan to test aggressive strategies. Firstly, I'll increase bids significantly for AB when my combined value is 160 to secure the allocation. Secondly, I'll bid slightly lower than my value for individual items, A and B. In rounds of lower values, I'll bid minimally for data gathering, to analyze other bidders' behavior. I'll leverage historical data to adjust my bids, particularly noting thresholds where my bids are outbid. I also intend to observe times when aggressive bidding for AB rewards more profit, given my values, for understanding profitability in future analogous settings.

For the next round, I plan to initially test with a high bid for AB. If my value is higher compared to other bidders, I benefit. If not, I can gauge competition and adjust. I also plan to bid slightly above my value for A or B if the other bidders have been consistently low. I will explore risky options like bidding my entire value for A or B, if the previous rounds indicate low competition. I aim to adjust my strategy based on previous round data and competitor behaviours.
Since my combined valuation is high, I will bid aggressively on AB, around $240. Additionally, to collect data, I'll place lower riskier bids on individual goods, around $30 for A and $90 for B.

I'll test conservative strategy by bidding significantly lower than my values for A and B. Exploring patterns, I'll bid half of my combined value for AB. Analyzing the result, I'll adjust future bids and tactics accordingly.
I will increase my bid for AB to 280, gauging reactions. If unsuccessful, I will in subsequent rounds bid slightly above my value for A and B, while cautiously testing bidding my entire valuation.

This round, for goods A and B wherever possible, I'll bid slightly above the previous round's highest bids. Since my valuation is double the sum of A and B, I will bid aggressively on AB at around $280.

Based on previous rounds, I'll continue varying strategies. On rounds with higher combined value, I will aggressively bid on AB above the exact sum. On rounds with lower individual values, I'll bid slightly below my valuations for A and B to optimize my profit.

For this round, I'd bid slightly above my values, say 20 for A and 80 for B, while decreasing my bid for AB to about 245. Strategically, this engages competition and safeguards against overpaying for AB while maximizing potential profit on individual goods.
